title: Did O'Reilly Automotive Operate In High Gear In Q2
text:
Meet 5 IBD 50 Stocks Reporting Earnings This Week 
Earnings season has kicked into high gear, and a number of top-rated stocks such as Vasco Data Security (NASDAQ:VDSI) and Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) are due to report earnings this coming week. The computer-generated IBD 50 list of premier stocks is based on a combination of each company's recent profit ... 07/25/2015 10:02 AM ET Valeant, Starbucks Lead 5 IBD 50 Stocks Bucking Market 
A handful of IBD 50 stocks got a boost last week, bucking overall market weakness, thanks to better-than-expected quarterly results. Illumina (NASDAQ:ILMN), which makes genetic testing equipment, was among the few disappointments. It plunged 8% Wednesday after Q2 sales trailed analysts' forecasts. ... 07/24/2015 07:14 PM ET Made In The USA: 4 All-American IBD 50 Firecrackers

Nascar is pretty All-American, right? The checkered flag, cars racing around the ... 07/02/2015 06:51 PM ET Stocks Rise For Second Day; Earnings Lift Acuity 
Stocks ended off their session highs Wednesday, but still gained for a second straight session amid hopes for Greece and better-than-expected economic data. The Nasdaq and the S&P 500 rose 0.5% and 0.7%, respectively. Both were up about 1% at Wednesday's high. Consumers are flexing their muscles as the economic recovery regains momentum, potentially giving a further lift to highly rated companies serving American shoppers. Today's IBD 50 list includes Ulta Beauty (NASDAQ:ULTA) and four other consumer stocks poised for big gains. Fiat Chrysler Automobile's (NYSE:FCAU) record fine for delaying recalls drove its share price down and likely will make its search for a merger partner more difficult. General Electric (NYSE:GE) reportedly plans on having a big role in energy storage, which is key to managing power volatility from energy surges and intermittent power sources like wind and solar. Upscale grocer Whole Foods Market (NASDAQ:WFM) is expected to report slowing earnings and revenue growth after the close Wednesday, but one analyst sees potential to grab market share in the online grocery delivery space. Planet Fitness set terms for an initial public offering that looks to raise $203 million for the franchisers and operators of fitness centers. Planet Fitness will offer 13.5 million shares at a price range of 14 to 16. It will list on the NYSE under the ticker PLNT.
